meanings.definition: To care for a child or children while the parents are away.
meanings.sent1: I will babysit my little sister tonight while mom and dad go out.
meanings.sent2: She babysits for her neighbors every Saturday evening.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear decided to babysit the other toys in the toy box.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to babysit the flowers, shining brightly on them all day.
meanings.sent5: Babysitting the kittens, the puppy wagged its tail happily.

meanings.definition: To supervise children in the absence of their parents.
meanings.sent1: Can you babysit the kids at the park while I run to the store?
meanings.sent2: She babysits her younger siblings when her parents are at work.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl was asked to babysit the baby birds in the nest.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse seemed to babysit the ships, guiding them safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: Babysitting the ducklings, the mother duck quacked to keep them in line.
